messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\UserController@index` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
- Full path: /v1/users

- All methods acceptable: false

- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

Explanation:
- In routes/api.php there is a route group with prefix('v1'), so all routes in that file are mounted under /v1.
- Inside that group the line Route::apiResource('users', UserController::class)->only(['index', 'show']); registers the resource collection route for "users" and, for the index action, that corresponds to the collection path /users. With the v1 prefix the full path is /v1/users.
- The index() action in app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/UserController.php is the controller method used for that route.
- The apiResource index action maps to an HTTP GET on the collection path (GET /users). No other HTTP methods for the collection are declared in the shown route definitions for this path.
- There are other resource registrations for users (an update route inside the authenticated middleware group), but that registers routes for the single-resource path /v1/users/{user} (PUT/PATCH) and does not affect the collection path /v1/users.
- No explicit HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, POST, PUT, DELETE or PATCH routes are declared for /v1/users in the provided code, so only GET is marked true. (I did not assume automatic framework behavior â€” only the explicit route registrations from the provided files were used.)
